subject: Re: [junit] Problem with set Suite() on swingui
msgSnippet: ... suiteName is only the name that will be displayed on the UI (typically what kind of TestCases it contains ( All the tests , database tests ...) The name
messageBody:
> setSuite(java.lang.String suiteName). There is know description on
> how to use this.


suiteName is only the name that will be displayed on the UI (typically
what kind of TestCases it contains ("All the tests", "database tests"...)

The name argument in the TestCase class has a _total_ other meaning:
it's the name of the method that will be called by the runner during the
execution.

Remember that if a TestCase has 7 test methods, new
TestSuite(theClass.class) will create a TestSuite with 7 elements, one
for each test method.

-Vladimir
